info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 6:58PM EDT until July 29 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Polk County in western North Carolina... Northwestern Spartanburg County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 745 PM EDT. * At 655 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Columbus, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Columbus, Landrum, Tryon, Campobello, Lake Bowen, Mill Spring, Green Creek, Lake Adger, Fingerville and Gowensville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
